thread.title: Mike Pence's Twitter account was live-tweeting about Israel using a picture of the wrong flag
thread.title_full: Mike Pence's Twitter account was live-tweeting about Israel using a picture of the wrong flag - Business Insider

author: Madeleine Sheehan Perkins
title: Mike Pence's Twitter account was live-tweeting about Israel using a picture of the wrong flag
text:
Vice President Mike Pence gave a speech at the Republican Jewish Coalition on Friday, and while he was speaking, his Twitter account was live-tweeting portions of the speech.
Several tweets from the account included a picture of a flag next to the word, "Israel." The image, however, was the Nicaraguan flag, not Israel's.
The tweets were removed after people on social media caught on to the mistake. You can see screenshots of the now-deleted tweets below:
Someone please tell the Pence social media team that's the flag of Nicaragua, not Israel pic.twitter.com/6KpfsCOCV6
â€” Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) February 25, 2017 Here's what the actual Israeli flag looks like: Zachi Evenor/Flickr
Pence said during speech, Trump and I stand with Israel because her cause is our cause, her values are our values, and her fight is our fight."
SEE ALSO: Mike Pence, the vice president of the United States, has said he doesn't believe that smoking kills More: Mike Pence Israel Nicaragua Republican Jewish Coalition
